greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of integer partitions of n containing no prime indices of the parts.
comment: These could be described as anti-transitive integer partitions.
A prime index of n is a number m such that prime(m) divides n. The multiset of prime indices of n is row n of A112798.
example: The a(1) = 1 through a(8) = 9 integer partitions:
xref: The subset version is A324741, with maximal case A324743. The strict case is A324751. The Heinz number version is A324758. An infinite version is A324695.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Mar 17 2019
